item.title: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter
item.dc:creator: @bbl111 bbl111
item.description:
@bbl111 wrote:

This

[code] if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0 && starter == 1) {
String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (muted == 1) {
            sendMessage("You are muted and cannot use the yell channel.");//This tells the people that are muted tey can't talk.
        } else if (starter == 0) {
            sendMessage("Sorry but you must type ::starter in order to use this command") //Tells people without starter must type it in order to use ::yell
        }[/code]

item.title: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter
item.dc:creator: @bbl111 bbl111

@bbl111 wrote:

Well he wants it so people only with the starter can do it. You need to state that you need starter == 1 to do that. The else will send them the message but they will still yell.

item.source: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter

item.title: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:9, topic:276813”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=365474.msg2772229#msg2772229 date=1241211078]
if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) {
String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (muted == 1) {
            sendMessage("You are muted and cannot use the yell channel.");
        } else if (starter == 0) {
            sendMessage("blah") // Put here whatever message you want to send them or not.
        }
    }
}

Try that.
[/quote]

There are too many braces.

[code] if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) {
String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (muted == 1) {
            sendMessage("You are muted and cannot use the yell channel.");
        } else if (starter == 0) {
            sendMessage("blah") // Put here whatever message you want to send them or not.
        }[/code][/quote]

That’s what he sent me lol. I closed a brace and opened one. I wasn’t paying attention to the other braces.

[quote=“bbl111, post:10, topic:276813”][code] if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0 && starter == 1) {
String text = command.substring(5);

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
                    + text.substring(1) + "";
        } else if (muted == 1) {
            sendMessage("You are muted and cannot use the yell channel.");
        } else if (starter == 0) {
            sendMessage("blah") // Put here whatever message you want to send them or not.
        }code]

You had to put a starter == 1 in beginning for the else to work.[/code][/quote]

I don’t think you have to. That’s what I was wondering so that’s why I said to him ‘try that.’ But now that I think about it, probably.

Read full topic

item.source: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter

item.title: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“bbl111, post:3, topic:276813”]just make one like this

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && starter == 1) {//player rights and the starter if (!muted) {//the mute part of the command String text = command.substring(5); String[] bad = { "chalreq", "duelreq", "tradereq" }; for (String element : bad) { if (text.indexOf(element) >= 0) { return; } } lastMessage[0] = lastMessage[1]; lastMessage[1] = lastMessage[2]; lastMessage[2] = Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1); if (lastMessage[0].equals(lastMessage[1]) && lastMessage[1].equals(lastMessage[2])) sM(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); else yell(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } else sM(playerName + ": " + command.substring(5)); }

That means you have to have did ::starter to get it. If its a different source just change the variables and stuff. But thats the basic layout.[/quote]

What if he ain’t Delta? That and that is a really long unnecessary code.

Read full topic

        if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == 0) {

            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
                    + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))

}

item.source: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter

item.title: How can i make ::yell working after ::starter
item.dc:creator: @bbl111 bbl111
item.description:
@bbl111 wrote:

just make one like this

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && starter == 1) {//player rights and the starter if (!muted) {//the mute part of the command String text = command.substring(5); String[] bad = { "chalreq", "duelreq", "tradereq" }; for (String element : bad) { if (text.indexOf(element) >= 0) { return; } } lastMessage[0] = lastMessage[1]; lastMessage[1] = lastMessage[2]; lastMessage[2] = Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1); if (lastMessage[0].equals(lastMessage[1]) && lastMessage[1].equals(lastMessage[2])) sM(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); else yell(playerName + ": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } else sM(playerName + ": " + command.substring(5)); }

That means you have to have did ::starter to get it. If its a different source just change the variables and stuff. But thats the basic layout.

Read full topic
